casebody.data:
CONTINENTAL/MOSS-GORDIN, INC., Appellant, v. Ronald W. HARP, Joe I. Tarica and Kelley G. Laminack, Appellees. No. 24375. United States Court of Appeals Fifth Circuit. Dec. 4, 1967. Calvin M. Whitesell, Montgomery, Ala., Robert I. Paller, Atlanta, Ga., Whitesell & Alton, Montgomery, Ala., and Smith, Cohen, Ringel, Kohler, Martin & Lowe, Atlanta, Ga., for appellant. William S. Mooneyham, Montgomery, Ala., for appellees. George D. Palmer, Atty., Dept, of Labor, Washington, D. C., Charles Donahue, Solicitor of Labor, Bessie. Margolin, Associate Solicitor, Robert E. Nagle, Paul A. McKean, Attorneys, U. S. Department of Labor, Washington, D. C., Beverley R. Worrell, Regional Atty., amici curiae.

Before RIVES, GOLDBERG and DYER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

The opinion and judgment of the district court are obviously correct under the authority of Foremost Dairies, Inc. v. Wirtz, 5 Cir. 1967, 381 F.2d 653.

Affirmed.
